question: This proposal effectively addresses the challenge
title: Impact
questions: Has the proposer provided a clear and concise description an issue or deficiency in their Problem Statement?
Have you checked if the problem statement defines a problem within the challenge which needs to be solved?
Have you checked if the proposal has a positive impact on the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem?
Have you checked if the proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem?
Do the KPIs indicated in the proposal match the ones indicated in the challenge? If not, how relevant are the indicated KPIs to this particular challenge?
Is the proposal able to scale to address future challenges?

question: Given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
title: Feasibility
questions: Does the proposer give account of what experience/skill sets will be necessary to deliver on the proposal?
Have you checked if the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
Does the proposer knows, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
Is the budget outlined clearly, understandable and broken down into identifiable items?
Is the budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
If additional funding is required to implement the proposal, has the proposer provided a verifiable plan in this regard?
Have you checked if there is a detailed implementable plan?
Have details of actionable tasks and order of execution been communicated?
Does the proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Does the proposal clearly explains technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
Have you checked that the proposers have indicated some awareness of the risks to the project and have given some indication of how they will mitigate them?

question: The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
title: Clarity/Auditability
questions: Does the proposal provide a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement?
Have you checked if metrics / KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) that define the success of the proposal are presented and make sense?
Can the KPIs provided be used to quantify success of the project?
Have you checked if the community can track the progress of the proposal?

question: This challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
title: Alignment
questions: What is the societal impact of the challenge?
Does the challenge help Cardano/Catalyst achieve its mission?

question: The Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge.
title: Feasibility
questions: Is it a challenge that welcomes a wide variety of solutions?
Is it reasonable to expect proposals that show results in the next six months or so?
Is the Challenge Team in place or is there a plan to create one?

question: Success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.
title: Verifiability
questions: Are the metrics measuring outcomes (correct) or outlining means to an end (incorrect)?
To what extent does the proposal address the problems identified in the challenge brief?
Does the proposal present relevant use cases already implemented using any technology suite?
